channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Guy's hospital in London will remove statues of their 'slave-trading' benefactor
item.description: Guy's and St Thomas' Hospital - where Boris Johnson received treatment for coronavirus in April - revealed that contentious statues of Thomas Guy and Robert Clayton would be removed

item.title: Priti Patel hits out at BBC comedian's astonishing 'fancy a curry' tweet
item.description: Comedian Guz Khan, posted a photo of Ms Patel pulling a face with the message: 'Shall we have a curry for dinner tonight Priti?'

item.title: Gavin and Stacey becomes the latest series to be dragged into race row
item.description: Critics are calling for the popular comedy, written by James Corden and Ruth Jones, to be pulled in the wake of the Black Lives Matter movement.

item.title: Coronavirus patients with low levels of blood protein were more likely to need ventilation
item.description: In a new study from Yale School of Medicine found that coronavirus patients with low levels of a blood protein, renalase, are more likely to be put on a ventilator and more likely to die.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 1 in 3 infected unreachable via test and trace
item.description: Between May 28 and June 3, 8,117 people who tested positive for the coronavirus were referred to the NHS's scheme. But data shows contact tracers could only get information from 67 per cent of them (5,407).

item.title: Home Office: Shamima Begum to blame for lost UK citizenship
item.description: Shamima Begum believes her citizenship should be restored because she cannot have a 'fair and effective appeal'. But Ms Begum chose to flee Britain and join IS, the Home Office said.

item.title: Alexis Ohanian says his wife Serena Williams helped him recognize his privilege
item.description: Reddit co-founder Alexis Ohanian, 37, says his wife Serena Williams helps him recognize his privilege by encouraging him to dig deeper on social issues and his own positions.

item.title: Wreck of gunboat which JFK commanded in WWII is discovered in Harlem River
item.description: New York City officials were lifting hardwood planks on Thursday because the MTA is building a $610M sea wall along the river to prevent flooding in the 207th Street train yard.

item.title: Police force has 'strong words' with curator over tweets on how to destroy statues with chemicals
item.description: An Oxford-educated museum curator who tweeted a guide on how to chemically destroy bronze statues has been forced to delete the posts after receiving a stern warning from police.

item.title: Coronavirus survivor in US receives double lung transplant
item.description: Surgeons at Northwestern Memorial Hospital in Chicago have given a new set of lungs to a young woman with severe lung damage from coronavirus. It's among the first such operations in the US.

item.title: Trump demands Republicans REJECT stripping Confederates' names from Army bases
item.description: President Trump demanded Republicans in Congress reject stripping Confederates names off of Army bases despite Senate Republicans already voting in favor of an amendment to do so.

item.title: Country group Lady Antebellum changes name to Lady A
item.description: Grammy-winning country group Lady Antebellum is changing its name to Lady A, after saying they are regretful and embarrassed for not taking into consideration the word's associations with slavery.

item.title: Footballer, 11, who was diagnosed with cancer days receives messages of support from sports stars
item.description: Thomas Cunningham, 11, from Liverpool, who has had trials with Liverpool and Everton, was diagnosed with stage four Hodgkin's Lymphoma after complaining that his left ear hurt.

item.title: South Carolina couple discovers giant megaldon shark tooth in a muddy river bed
item.description: A South Carolina couple made a surprising discovery while exploring a river near Charleston. The pair found a massive megalodon shark tooth that is larger than a human hand.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson is joined by mystery pal in wolf outfit as she dresses up as Little Red Riding Hood
item.description: The Duchess of York, 60, donned a red hooded cape and was joined by a mystery guest in a wolf mask and nightgown as she put on a very animated performance of Little Red Riding Hood.

item.title: Baseball bat hero tells of moment he waded in to help officer grappling on ground with a suspect
item.description: Kemran spotted the officer in trouble outside a block of flats in Hackney, east London, yesterday and ran downstairs to intervene before the officer was seriously hurt.

item.title: Mother finds out she was one of the first Brits to get coronavirus after suffering a mystery rash
item.description: Doctors first feared Sarah Churchill, from Bournemouth, Dorset, was suffering from blood cancer or HIV when painful rashes flared up on her hands and feet in February.

item.title: Coronavirus: Isle of Man ends social distancing
item.description: The Isle of Man's Chief Minister Howard Quayle said during his coronavirus press briefing that the decision had been taken to 'get society back to normal'.

item.title: Old lady drives her Volvo into social distance queue at Morrisons
item.description: A car driven by an elderly lady has crashed into eight pedestrians queuing outside a Morrisons in Paignton, Devon, with all five customers being taken to hospital.

item.title: Pictured: The gun used to kill journalist Lyra McKee, who was shot dead during Northern Ireland riot
item.description: Images have been released of the gun used to kill Lyra McKee in Northern Ireland, after police confirmed it was the weapon used in shooting of the journalist.

item.title: Church where GH Elliott is buried considers erasing his 'deeply offensive' stage persona
item.description: The Archdeacon of Brighton and Lewes wants to remove the 'deeply offenisve' wording and his grave was today being boarded up while the church decides what steps to take.

item.title: Health Secretary Matt Hancock pleads with anti-racism protesters not to attend demonstrations
item.description: Matt Hancock pleaded with anti-racism protesters to avoid large crowds. But he did the briefing alongside Dido Harding who sits on the board of Cheltenham-organisers the Jockey Club.

item.title: Nigel Farage quits LBC radio show as contract not renewed
item.description: The Brexiteer has hosted his own hourly evening slot from Mondays to Thursdays as well as a mid-morning show on Sundays since 2017.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi says it is 'the perfect time' to rid the Capitol of Confederate statues
item.description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said Thursday it was 'the perfect time' for the 11 remaining Confederate statues on display on Capitol Hill to be sent packing.

item.title: Beautiful Italian village Cinquefrondi is selling houses for £1
item.description: A quaint little Italian village has seen a sale on properties for as little as just £1, as local authorities bid to regenerate the area which has seen large parts left abandoned and neglected.

item.title: Chinese women 'should be allowed to have multiple husbands'
item.description: Prof Yew-Kwang Ng, a 77-year-old economist, said that his proposition could be a way to help the nation's 30million bachelors find their better half as well as happiness.

item.title: Former Scouts stop removal of Poole Lord Baden-Powell statue
item.description: Former Scouts today vowed to defend the seaside statue of Robert Baden-Powell due to be hauled down later after Black Lives Matter protesters branded him racist and homophobic.

item.title: Molly-Mae Hague's puppy was 'healthy' when the Love Island star got him, claims breeder
item.description: Breeder Tiffany Puppies has released a statement on Instagram following the death of Pomeranian puppy Mr Chai.

item.title: Cyprus's deputy tourism minister says quarantine hotels will have a holiday vibe
item.description: Cyprus's deputy tourism minister Savvas Perdios told MailOnline Travel that Cyprus is creating three quarantine hotels and that staying in them 'will still feel like a holiday'.

item.title: Children's lives were 'put on hold' in Covid-19 pandemic to benefit the middle-aged and elderly
item.description: Professor Russell Viner, president of the Royal College of Paediatrics and Child Health, suggested the decision to protect the elder generations has come at a cost.

item.title: Abortion numbers reach record high with 210,000 in England and Wales last year
item.description: The 209,519 terminated pregnancies in England and Wales in 2019 was the highest number seen since the 1967 Abortion Act was introduced, the Department of Health confirmed yesterday.

item.title: Mother convicted of attempted murder protests her innocence in new documentary
item.description: Danita Tutt, 44, from Texas, who was convinced of attempting to murder then 13-year-old son has protested her innocence in the Crime+Investigation documentary, Accused: Guilty or Innocent?

item.title: Police WON'T stop statues being toppled by BLM protestors
item.description: Police chief Ben-Julian Harrington has said that the force won't stop statues being toppled by Black Lives Matter protestors if officers and the public's safety is put at risk.

item.title: Trump invites random man to golf then blocks him when he calls him a despicable human being
item.description: Donald Trump appears to have been left feeling rejected after Welshman Liam Bennett refused his offer for a game of golf and instead called on him to resign.

item.title: Coronavirus IS seasonal, maps that help predict spread show
item.description: A new study found that eight cities that had 'substantial' spread of coronavirus were all on a narrow band of latitude with similar cold temperatures and low levels of humidity.

item.title: Police launch probe after angry crowd of Coventry City football fans pelt two black men with bottles
item.description: Police protected two black men who were chased through Coventry city by an angry mob who were pelting them with stones and bottles having wrongly accused the men of carrying knives.

item.title: Trump says domestic terrorists have taken over Seattle and demands CHAZ be retaken
item.description: 'Radical Left Governor [of Washington, Jay Inslee] and the Mayor of Seattle are being taunted and played at a level that our great Country has never seen before,' Trump tweeted on Wednesday.

item.title: 'Proud working class' woman behind campaign to remove Baden-Powell statue was Corbyn's candidate
item.description: Former Labour candidate Corrie Drew demanded the statue in Poole Quay, Bournemouth be removed and council leader Vikki Slade has said the structure will be taken down 'immediately'.

item.title: Stunned sunbathers watch as 'smugglers' crash their speedboat onto a Spanish beach
item.description: The alleged offenders rammed their boat into sand at high speed and made off. The incident took place on a beach in Cádiz, Spain.

item.title: Onlooker screams in horror as a group of women dance on a shaking glass walkway 390ft above ground
item.description: Terrifying footage shows two rows of women, who appeared to be middle-aged, dancing enthusiastically on the trembling platform at a scenic spot in Hangzhou city of eastern China.

item.title: Barclays boss was furious after financier got more credit than his ex-wife for bringing in £2bn deal
item.description: Amanda Staveley, 47, claims her private equity firm PCP Capital Partners is owed money for the work it did setting up a Middle East investment deal for the bank.

item.title: Prince Harry reveals he 'feels pressure' to give his children 'the future they deserves'
item.description: Prince Harry said in an open letter to conservationist group African Parks revealed today that 'some evidence suggests that the virus' origins may be linked to our exploitation of nature'.

item.title: Nick Robinson apologises after 'blackface' discussion on Today
item.description: BBC host Nick Robinson (pictured) tweeted he is 'really sorry a racial slur was used on air' after comedian Harry Enfield said 'c**n' during a debate on the use of blackface in comedy this morning.

item.title: BBC newsreader George Alagiah, 64, reveals his bowel cancer has spread to his lungs
item.description: George Alagiah, 64, has revealed that doctors told him in April that his bowel cancer has spread to his lungs, having already spread to his liver and lymph nodes.

item.title: Rainbow fish behave like bullfighters, study says
item.description: Rainbow fish behave like matadors by darting away from their predators at the last moment to avoid being eaten, a new study at the University of Exeter reveals.

item.title: Ancient 13-foot crocodile that lived in South Korea 120 million years ago walked on two legs
item.description: An international team of researchers from analysed the large and well-preserved fossil tracks, which were found at the Sacheon Jahye-ri dig site in South Korea.

item.title: Rishi Sunak BACKS easing two metre rule amid Tory pressure on PM
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon said scientific advice was that the limit should stay for now, warning that the places where reducing it might help business could also be the riskiest for fuelling the outbreak.

item.title: Easing Britain's lockdown any further may be 'disastrous' and lead to 75,000 more Covid-19 deaths
item.description: Modelling by a mathematician from Ulster University in Northern Ireland found easing lockdown by 50 per cent would cause an epidemic 1.5 times worse than the first, which killed 50,000.

item.title: Britain's coronavirus death toll jumps by 151 as official number of victims reaches 41,279
item.description: Department of Health statistics reveal the number of daily lab-confirmed Covid-19 fatalities is just 14 per cent lower than the 176 recorded last Thursday.

item.title: Stormzy pledges £10M to organisations fighting racial inequality
item.description: Rapper Stormzy has pledged £10 million, over 10 years, to organisations, charities and movements tackling racial inequality, justice reform and black empowerment in the UK.

item.title: Harry Potter stars Emma Watson and Bonnie Wright stir up JK Rowling transphobia storm
item.description: Miss Watson, 30, who found fame as Hermione Granger, and Miss Wright, 29, who played Ginny Weasley, both chose to intervene in the row that has seen Ms Rowling accused of transphobia.

item.title: Astronauts create 'exotic' fifth state of matter on the International Space Station
item.description: This exotic and rare form of matter is only produced when a gas of boson like particles are cooled to temperatures just above absolute zero (about -459.67F).

item.title: Nando's launches kits to create PERi-PERi dish at home
item.description: For just £6 per person, British customers will be sent everything they need to recreate one of Nando's signature dishes at home. The chain has teamed up with recipe box brand Mindful Chef.

item.title: School DROPS plans to name house after JK Rowling amid 'transphobia' row
item.description: Weald Community School in West Sussex will instead honour Malorie Blackman after distancing itself from the Harry Potter author who caused outrage after implying only women could menstruate.

item.title: The Sopranos creator David Chase accidentally reveals what really happened to Tony Soprano
item.description: The final scene of The Sopranos has kept fans debating for more than a decade over the fate of main character Tony Soprano but show creator David Chase may now have revealed the truth.

item.title: Pictured: Secret compartment used to smuggle Albanian immigrants
item.description: Customs officers found two Albanians hidden in a crawl space in the roof of a Romanian-registered minibus that arrived in Dover in May. The men, circled, were hidden behind a sheet of plywood.

item.title: Mother-of-four pens heartfelt post revealing she can't remember the last time she was really happy
item.description: Jessica Hood, 31, who lives in Melbourne, shared the realities of motherhood in a candid post on Instagram. The mother-of-four explained she's lost her sense of self and can't remember being happy.

item.title: Drunk driver is jailed for six years for running over his stepmother THREE times
item.description: Ben Ashman, 37, drove his Vauxhall Grandland into guests in the car park of the Bowburn Hall Hotel, Durham at the end of his stepbrother's wedding on August 23.

item.title: Sir Thomas Picton's descendant says statue should come down
item.description: A relative of Waterloo hero Sir Thomas Picton has called for his statue in Cardiff to be removed and put into a museum, saying he was 'rather embarrassed' to be a descendant.

item.title: Olympians Laura and Jason Kenny share their joy as son Albert learns how to ride a bike in lockdown
item.description: The professional cyclist, 28, ran alongside her little one in a video shared to Instagram on Wednesday.

item.title: Schools in England will close to all pupils over summer holidays
item.description: Schools across England will not remain open during the summer holidays for the children of key workers, Downing Street confirmed today.

item.title: Racist past of Confederate generals with military bases named after them
item.description: Donald Trump last night ruled out renaming the 10 US bases named after Confederate generals despite their links to slavery and racial oppression, saying they were 'hallowed grounds'.

item.title: Moment dozens of police surround home of 'suspected paedophile'
item.description: Police Scotland descended on a tower block in Royston, Glasgow at around 7pm yesterday after more than 100 people gathered in a protest.

item.title: Amazon faces EU antitrust charges over third-party sellers
item.description: The European Commission will file charges against Amazon over its treatment of third-party sellers as early as next week, sources told The Wall Street Journal.

item.title: Woman photographs her dog sitting like a human in viral Twitter thread
item.description: Brittany Lashay, from Orlando, her blue nose Pitbull, Sparks, sitting on his hind legs and posted a photo to Twitter which has racked up a million likes, with people sharing their snaps.

item.title: Mayor of Middlesbrough defends statues of Captain Cook after it is targeted for removal as 'racist'
item.description: Andy Preston has said Teessiders are proud of the 18th-century explorer and statues of him in Middlesbrough, Great Ayton and Whitby should not be torn down.

item.title: UK's 'racist' road names, statues and gravestones covered up
item.description: Paint was thrown at a statue of Admiral Lord Nelson at Deptford Town Hall in South East London, while the gravestone of music hall singer GH Elliott was covered up in Rottingdean, East Sussex.

item.title: Meghan Markle's best friend Jessica Mulroney left black influencer 'paralysed with fear'
item.description: Influencer Sasha Exeter, from Toronto, shared a lengthy Instagram post detailing how she argued with Meghan Markle's best friend Jessica Mulroney, 40, about the Black Lives Matter movement.

item.title: India sees a record 10,000 coronavirus cases in a day while reopening restaurants and temples
item.description: India's tally has reached 286,579 confirmed cases, the fifth highest in the world, with 8,102 deaths, including 357 in the last 24 hours. Dr Harjit Singh Bhatti warned government to up healthcare spending.

item.title: The high-flying shortlisted images in Agora's aerial photography contest from Spain to the USA
item.description: Over 9,018 photos were submitted to the contest with those making the shortlist including a mesmerising shot of castle ruins in Austria and a beautiful aerial photo of Barcelona.

item.title: Fury as Cabinet minister Robert Jenrick ducks questioning over housing development for Tory donor
item.description: Figures from the Electoral Commission show that Richard Desmond donated £12,000 to the party in January after the Housing Secretary gave the green light to his plan to build homes in east London.

item.title: Sales Assistant reveals she's breached the 'no sex rule'
item.description: Sales assistant Claire, 32, from Liverpool, has told of the 'explosive sex' she has enjoyed with multiple married men in breach of lockdown, and called the sex ban 'crazy'.

item.title: Russia responds to NATO wargames in Baltic Sea by sending combat jets to carry out practice strikes
item.description: Russia's Baltic Fleet revealed in a statement that a dozen of its Su-24, Su-27 and Su-30 aircrafts practised strikes on Thursday amid increasingly fraught tensions with the West.

item.title: Queen's reign is 'effectively over' due to Covid-19, royal biographer claims
item.description: Andrew Morton told The Telegraph that he can't see how the Queen can resume her job, and claimed coronavirus has 'done more damage to the monarchy than Oliver Cromwell'.

item.title: Some parts of the UK have almost a FIFTH of population on furlough scheme at cost of £20billion
item.description: London has been the worst affected area, with all but one of the areas with the most furloughed posts covered by the Job Retention Scheme laying within the capital.

item.title: Angry Twitter users threaten to BOYCOTT The Body Shop
item.description: The Body Shop advised author J.K Rowling to educate herself about transgender rights in a Twitter post, just hours after she posted an essay about women's rights and gender identity.

item.title: Cancer time bomb fears as NHS figures show 60% drop in urgent referrals
item.description: A total of 79,573 urgent cancer referrals were made by GPs in England in April 2020, down from 199,217 in April 2019, according to NHS data.

item.title: Britons are left baffled by Boris Johnson's plan for 'support bubbles'
item.description: The plans announced by the Prime Minister mean couples could be reunited after being kept apart by restrictions and some grandparents will be able to hug their grandchildren from Saturday.

item.title: Terrifying moment lorry sideswipes car while changing lanes and shunts it down the M1
item.description: The lorry was changing lanes when the collision happened near to Leeds. Dashcam captures moment lorry shunts the car and smoke billows in the air.

item.title: People who eat a late dinner just before bed are more likely to gain weight
item.description: American researchers monitored 20 people as they slept and found eating one hour before bed causes the body to burn ten per cent less fat overnight.

item.title: The world's largest cashew tree covers two acres of a park in Brazil and looks like a mini forest
item.description: The tree is located next to an urban beach in Brazil. The limbs of the tree - which is the size of about 70 regular cashew trees - spread out 164ft from the central trunk.

item.title: DIY antibody tests are STILL not available for Britons
item.description: The Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) pulled the home testing kits, which check if someone has previously had the disease, from UK chemists on May 26.

item.title: Prince William has virtual selfie with NHS staff in Aintree
item.description: LiverpoolHospitals Instagram page revealed the Critical Care teams at Aintree and the Royal received a surprise video call from Prince William, 38, - who praised the 'fantastic job' they're doing.

item.title: Dele Alli handed one match ban for appearing to mock Asian man over coronavirus
item.description: The Tottenham star has been at the centre of an FA investigation and will now miss his team's Project Restart opener against Manchester United a week on Friday.

item.title: Spurned boyfriend stabbed his partner and her 11-month-old son
item.description: Rehan Khan, 27, repeatedly knifed Salma Sheikh, 33, and her 11-month-old son at her home in Feltham, west London with a purple kitchen knife, having messaged her 270 times before the attack.

item.title: Pollen DNA is being studied in a bid to help hay fever sufferers
item.description: A team of scientists at Bangor University are sampling 40 common species of grass, including cocksfoot, Timothy and meadow foxtail to find which strains of pollen cause hay fever.

item.title: First ever black head of Oxford College calls for statue of Cecil Rhodes to be removed
item.description: Baroness Valerie Amos, who is currently director of London's School of Oriental and African Studies, said that there is no need to glorify Cecil Rhodes with a statue while understanding history.

item.title: Airline passengers told NOT to take hand luggage on planes to stop spread of Covid-19
item.description: Department for Transport advice insists travellers should check in all baggage before boarding, and that avoiding the scramble to claim bags from lockers will 'minimise the risk of transmission'.

item.title: Lockdown has blocked £182 a WEEK of household spending
item.description: The draconian curbs to combat coronavirus mean more than a fifth of average outgoings have not been possible since March.

item.title: Abundance of spring flowers 'could fuel summer droughts'
item.description: An abundance of spring flowers, such as daffodils, crocuses and tulips, could fuel summer droughts, scientists claim, based on new computer simulations.

item.title: Tech giants work together to try and end online child sexual abuse
item.description: The Technology Coalition, whose members include industry giants, plans to improve collaboration between firms to help fight online child abuse around the world.
item.media:description: Tech giants have announced a new joint effort designed to better tackle child sexual abuse content online (Dominic Lipinski/PA)

item.title: Jeremy Clarkson's new six-bedroom Cotswolds mansion takes shape
item.description: Jeremy Clarkson, 60, blew up the old Cotswold farmhouse as a spectacular stunt on his Amazon show The Grand Tour - with the rebuilt mansion now starting to take shape.

item.title: British Gas parent company Centrica axing 5,000 jobs this year
item.description: The group, which employs over 27,000 people and has over three-quarters of its workforce based in the UK, is undergoing a major restructuring amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry 'discussed Megxit before they got married'
item.description: The explosive new biography Finding Freedom will detail how the Duke, 35, and Duchess of Sussex, 38, 'discussed Megxit before marrying', sources told The Sun.

item.title: Another 44 migrants are caught crossing the English Channel
item.description: They were rescued in three boats this morning and were seen being taken into the Port of Dover by the Border Force vessel Seeker around 11am.

item.title: Belgium REOPENS 1996 murder case possibly linked to Madeleine McCann suspect Christian Brueckner
item.description: Carola Titze, 16, vanished on the morning of July 5, 1996 while holidaying with her parents at a Flemish resort in De Haan, West Flanders. Her mutilated body was found six days later on sand dunes.

item.title: Neighbours launch bid to stop celebrity architect building futuristic underground house
item.description: Neighbours living in a townhouse in Holland Park have asked Court of Appeal judges to give them the right to stop architect Sophie Hicks' 'unique' development.

item.title: Nazi memorabilia collector caught with weapons sends chilling warning to police officers
item.description: Thomas Gill, 25, has been jailed for one year after police officers discovered a range of prohibited weapons at his home in Bangor Close, Eston. Gill told officers: 'I'll be a serial killer in 10 years'.

item.title: F1 legend Michael Schumacher 'to have stem cell surgery within days from Dr Philippe Menasche'
item.description: Michael Schumacher is set to have stem cell surgery by a world renowned doctor in a bid to regenerate his nervous system

item.title: Norway mosque shooter is jailed for 21 years
item.description: Philip Manshaus, 22, shot and killed Johanne Zhangjia Ihle-Hansen, 17, in their family home near Oslo. He then drove to the nearby al-Noor Islamic Centre and opened fire.

item.title: Coronavirus deaths could be HALF the official toll
item.description: Professor Karol Sikora, a UK-based former World Health Organization adviser, said doctors would be putting the virus on death certificates when there was 'any hint' it could have been involved.

item.title: O2´s 5G service reaches 60 towns and cities in the UK
item.description: Telecoms provider O2 has switched on its 5G network in a total of 60 towns and cities across the UK in the midst of arson attacks on the network's infrastructure.

item.title: How to safely use someone else's toilet
item.description: Speaking to FEMAIL, personal hygiene experts based in the UK offered their advice to guests looking to use the facilities while visiting a friend or family member.

item.title: Woman is caught by police for stealing £1,300 from elderly women
item.description: Tracey MacDonald, pictured, was jailed for a year by Manchester Crown Court after she was convicted of targeting five elderly women in distraction thefts between February and April 2018.

item.title: Ofsted chief says teachers need a more 'optimistic approach' to reopen schools
item.description: Amanda Spielman, the chief inspector of schools, today piled the pressure on teachers to do more to get children back into the classroom as soon as possible.

item.title: Brought bark to life! Two drowned puppies are saved with CPR by builders on Thai construction site
item.description: The frail pooches were found in small pool of water near a construction site in Trang, southern Thailand, last Wednesday after builders spotted the mother pulling a pup from the water.

item.title: Man is critically injured in Virginia after Confederate statue is toppled and falls on head
item.description: The man, believed to be in his thirties, had been part of a group of protesters attempting to topple the statue of the president of the Confederacy at around 11pm on Wednesday evening.

item.title: Indian police seize £140m of gems and jewellery from Nirav Modi's safe as he fights extradition
item.description: Indian authorities say the gems belong to billionaire Nirav Modi, 49, and his uncle Mehul Choksi, whose jewels once adorned stars from Bollywood to Hollywood.

item.title: Terrifying moment swimmer is dragged underwater by a CROCODILE
item.description: Footage taken near the Kaliasot Dam in Bhopal, central India, shows the moment the croc clamped its jaw around the right thigh of 30-year-old Amit Jatav.

item.title: Escape to the country? Rise in the number of buyers leaving London for the Home Counties
item.description: Property developers and estate agents spoke to FEMAIL about the rise in buyers looking to leave their cramped homes in the capital for larger properties - and, crucially, outdoor space,

item.title: One's first Zoom! The Queen takes part in a video call from Windsor Castle
item.description: The Queen, 94, joined the Princess Royal, 69, on a conference call with four carers living across the UK who have been responsible for looking after family during the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: McDonald's addict who would visit the fast food restaurant five times a week lost four stone
item.description: Emma Sinclair, 23, from Gateshead, Tyne and Wear, lost four stone in three months and went from 17st 12lb to 13st 12lb, after ditching her McDonald's breakfasts for a boiled egg on toast.

item.title: Keir Starmer calls for empty theatres, museums and libraries to be used as classrooms
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer today urged Boris Johnson to turn the nation's empty theatres, museums, libraries and leisure centres into classrooms to get children back to school as soon as possible.

item.title: Shocking moment test pilot was nearly killed by hoverbike's spinning rotor blades
item.description: The Dubai police officer is thrown backwards into the spinning blades of a hoverbike that he is testing to be used as a first responder aircraft after climbing 80ft over aircraft's 'maximum altitude'.

item.title: Drivers reveal the VERY strange they've been stopped by police
item.description: People from around the world have taken to anonymous sharing app Whisper to reveal the very surprising reasons they've been stopped by police officers while driving.

item.title: Why migraine sufferers get the debilitating condition, and the foods you can eat to beat the pain
item.description: Migraine is a leading cause of disability in Australia with symptoms ranging from a mild headache to vomiting, sensitivity to light, fainting, temporary loss of vision and paralysis.

item.title: Boy, eight, gets a criminal record after trying to pay with a toy banknote at Swiss shop
item.description: Newspapers suggested the shop, in Dietgen, northern Switzerland, and the police were overzealous in the case where the boy's name will be on police records until May 2032.

item.title: Men 'create more greenhouse gas emissions than women'
item.description: The transportation habits of men may account for more greenhouse gas emissions than women, according to a new study from New Zealand, which examined transport data for 50,000 residents.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... tearing down statues
item.description: 'The protesters agreed Nelson's Column could stay - as long as he took the knee'

item.title: Cream of the summer crops: Show off the ankle
item.description: Anna Pursglove shares her advice for wearing cropped trousers this season. She said the modern version is slightly longer as she shares her choice of the best from the UK High Street.

item.title: Everyday Ageism: FEMAIL columnist CHRISTA D'SOUZA
item.description: Christa D'souza asks if you find yourself giving the elderly an extra-wide berth now lockdown has been eased. The UK columnist said she watched the everyday ageism play out in her local Co-op.

item.title: Russian lion cub had legs broken 'so it could not escape while tourists posed for photos with it'
item.description: Vladimir Putin was so shocked that he personally ordered a criminal probe into the cruelty Simba the lion experienced, who was just a few weeks old when snatched from his mother.

item.title: Inside the Indian tribe once feared for decapitating their rivals and displaying severed body parts
item.description: A series of striking photographs reveals the distinctive facial features of the frail Konyak people, sporting nose plugs, brandishing spears, and wearing jewellery crafted from dead animals.
